feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Winter Storm Watch issued November 11 at 4:51AM AKST until November 13 at 3:00AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY MORNING THROUGH LATE SUNDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions possible. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 7 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...Kivalina and Red Dog Dock and Baldwin Peninsula, including the city of Kotzebue.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Baldwin Peninsula; Kivalina and Red Dog Dock

entry.cap:areaDesc: Bering Strait Coast; Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Interior Seward Peninsula; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 11 at 4:31AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM TO BRING TRANSITIONS BETWEEN SNOW, RAIN, AND FREEZING RAIN ON SUNDAY... A frontal system will begin to push inland across Southwest Alaska on Sunday morning. Conditions will initially be cold enough for snow as precipitation first arrives, but much warmer air aloft will lead to a quick transition to rain for the Kuskokwim
entry.cap:areaDesc: Bristol Bay; Kuskokwim Delta

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 10 at 5:47PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Increasing Snow Threats Sunday night Through Thursday... A front will usher in a period of wintery weather conditions for most of the Interior beginning Sunday night. This first initial front will bring widespread snowfall with a general range of 2 to 4 inches possible, locally heavier amounts to the west of Fairbanks of 4 to 7 inches, through Tuesday. A second storm
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Interior; Chatanika River Valley; Dalton Highway Summits; Eielson AFB and Salcha; Fairbanks Metro Area; Goldstream Valley and Nenana Hills; Nenana; South Slopes Of The Central Brooks Range; Tanana Flats; Two Rivers; Upper Chena River Valley; Upper Koyukuk Valley; White Mountains and High Terrain South of the Yukon River
